args: As Grace grew close to a Syndicate researcher\nnamed Barth, she eventually learned he was\ncreated from the body of her former husband.
Okay, so lover boy over there is actually\nyour reincarnated husband?
Not exactly. Though he looks identical,\nhe did not receive any of my husband's\nmemories.
He's lived his entire life based on false\npretenses given to him by the Syndicate.
So he has no idea he actually sprang out\nof a tank of goo or whatever?

No, they hid that—likely to prevent him
from suffering a mental breakdown.
It seems the only person who knew
the entire truth was the Preceptor.
Okay, so he's another experiment.\nBut there's something that doesn't\nsit right with me...
Unlike all the other experiments,\nhe didn't have his freedom taken away.
And it also sounds like he had no intention\nof leaving the Syndicate. So what was the\npoint in saving him?
He deserves to know his origins—and once\nhe does, I am positive he will come to\nunderstand our position.
You said they used parts of a fiend to\nmake him, right?
So how can you guarantee he won't be a\ndanger—and why are you so damn sure\nhe'll want to join up with us?
I suppose I'm not certain on either count.

I've actually been awake for a while now.
Tell me it isn't true, Grace. Tell me I'm
not made from fiend parts even though...
even though it all makes so much sense.
My past has never felt like my own. Never.\nIt's more like a series of images that I've\nnever been able to connect with.
My voice? My appearance? It's not me!\nIt all belongs to your husband!
So is that who I am?! Did I even choose to\nfall in love with you, or was that all just\nsome predetermined outcome?!
I don't know... I don't know! I don't know\nI don't know Idon'tknowIdon'tknowIdon't\nAAAAAAAAAAAAAH!
He's having a mental breakdown which\nis causing the fiend inside him to react!
Stop this, Barth! You must remain calm!
I'm sorry, Grace, but he's too far gone.\nRenegade Queen!
This is terrible! We have to find a way to\nstop him before he kills us all!
No! There's a cliff over there!
I assume his condition is grave?
You saw how huge of a drop that was.\nFiend or not, there was no way he was\ngonna be okay.
He'll probably die if we leave him here,\nbut...what do you want to do?
Perhaps I am getting ahead of myself by\ncalling this the savior of those subjects.
But I will wield this sword if it is the\nonly hope they have left.
Perhaps it's not the right way to save\nthem, but I won't use that excuse to\nsimply stand by and do nothing.
Though I am plagued with regrets and\ndoubt, I will still do what is right.
That is the only way I can atone.
My death was the only thing I could think\nabout after I lost the man I loved.
But that changed after I met Aldred.\nI decided to live again so I might walk\nthe path of atonement once more.
And now you've allowed me to question\nthat anew.
To reaffirm I have the strength to atone,\nno matter how painful it might be.
I really thought this might work, Bellina.\nI yearned for it with all that I am.
I kept hoping that my husband's memories\nwere lying dormant inside Barth and that\nwe could somehow bring them back.
You can't bring back the dead. That's why\nwe make the most of the life we have—\nand why you're atoning.
But right at the end there, that\nfiend could have been acting on\nyour husband's wishes.
...I think it's all right for you to imagine\nthat much.
I never thought the day would come where\nyou would be comforting me.
What, you think I can't comfort people?!
Let us make our way to the Halidom.\nWe need to take care of those people\nwe freed from the Syndicate.
(I may waver or be overcome with despair\nin the future, but I will not falter.)
(I will embrace all of those feelings and\ncontinue moving forward.)
(Because that is how we atone, my love.)
